stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: None
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: State Dept. and DoD email addresses were targeted by spear-phishing emails with "no theme" as the theme. The email body was written in English, but the subject line and attachments were in Ukrainian.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious FQDN Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: Domain callback for executable malware attached to email

marking:Marking_Structure.TOUMarking:Terms_Of_Use: This Indicator Bulletin is provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. The DHS does not endorse any commercial product or service, referenced in this bulletin or otherwise. This document is marked TLP: AMBER. Recipients may only share TLP: AMBER information with members of their own organization, and only as widely as necessary to act on that information. For more information on the Traffic Light Protocol, see http://www.us-cert.gov/tlp .

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious IPv4 Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: Russian IP Address likely to be C2 callback for malware. Uses port: 4443 for callback.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious File Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: Ukrainian language attachment, so cyrillic system doesn't show although "Mercy Corp" is included in English in the filename.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious File Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: Ukrainian language attachment, so cyrillic system doesn't show although "Mercy Corp" is included in English in the filename. Executable file that drops malware and calls back to C2 servers.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious File Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: Second malicious executable file which called back to several domains, likely C2 servers

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: Spear-phishing email with the subject line of "No theme" and files attached
